articles.author: Keane Bourke
articles.title: WA records 4,037 new COVID-19 cases after lower numbers over weekend, with 109 in hospital - ABC News
articles.description: After a fall in new cases over the weekend, Western Australia reports more than 4,000 infections to start the week — more than half of them from self-reported rapid antigen tests — with 109 people in hospital.
articles.content:
Case numbers in WA have risen again after dipping over the weekend, with 4,037 new infections recorded. Key points:
  • The number of new cases is still short of Friday's record of 5,005
